name: Return to your home safely
description: Learn how to return to your home safely after the wildfires

name: Insurance Protection
description: California protects you from losing your home insurance. State law prevents insurance companies from canceling or not renewing home insurance policies for one year in areas near a wildfire

name: Insurance Claim Help
description: California Department of Insurance (CDI) gives help in many languages including resources for wildfire victims and claims tips

name: Licensed Contractor Search
description: Find a licensed contractor to protect yourself from unlicensed contractors who often prey on disaster survivors

name: License Verification
description: Verify a professional license status such as current, expired, suspended, or revoked

name: Building Permits
description: Get a building permit online or at your local building and safety office before starting to rebuild

name: Rebuilding Guidance
description: Get an overview of what it will take to rebuild your home with important deadlines coming in March

name: Unemployment Assistance
description: Apply for unemployment if you lost your job due to the fire

name: Disability Insurance
description: Apply for disability if you are sick or hurt due to the fires

name: Paid Family Leave
description: Apply for Paid Family Leave if you need time off to care for your family and can't work

name: CalJOBS
description: Apply for a new job on California's online job exchange system

name: Jobs and Training
description: Get general support, referrals, and training to find a new job in California

name: Fire Cleanup Worker Safety
description: Learn how to keep yourself safe while working on fire cleanup

name: Income Tax Relief
description: People in Los Angeles County affected by the fires may postpone filing and paying taxes until October 15, 2025

name: Property Tax Relief
description: Apply for property tax reassessment with extended deadlines until April 2026 for people affected by the LA fires
